	The Accountant at Nosagie Holdings will be responsible for managing and maintaining accurate financial records across the group&rsquo;s Strategic Business Units, which include engineering, education, hospitality, FMCG, healthcare, and finance.
	The role involves preparing and analyzing financial statements, ensuring compliance with accounting standards, and monitoring the flow of income and expenditure to support effective decision-making.
	The Accountant will handle general ledger reconciliations, manage accounts payable and receivable, oversee payroll, and ensure timely preparation of tax returns and statutory filings.
	In addition, the role requires assisting in budget preparation, monitoring budget performance, and supporting audits by providing accurate documentation and explanations of financial transactions.
	The Accountant will work closely with management to provide insights on financial performance, highlight areas for cost control, and ensure transparency in all financial dealings.
	This position demands accuracy, integrity, and the ability to manage multiple accounts across different sectors, while adapting to the unique financial reporting needs of each business unit.
	The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of accounting principles, strong analytical skills, and the capacity to maintain high standards of confidentiality and professionalism.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND, HND, or Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 5-10 years of experience.


Salary
N170,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Accountant Job at Nosagie Holdings




        
    

        
        Nosagie Holdings is an indigenous registered company, having its headquarters office located in Benin City, Edo State. It provides EPIC and Project Management Services for the Offshore/Onshore Oil & Gas, Refining and Petrochemicals Industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Accountant at Nosagie Holdings will be responsible for managing and maintaining accurate financial records across the group’s Strategic Business Units, which include engineering, education, hospitality, FMCG, healthcare, and finance.
	The role involves preparing and analyzing financial statements, ensuring compliance with accounting standards, and monitoring the flow of income and expenditure to support effective decision-making.
	The Accountant will handle general ledger reconciliations, manage accounts payable and receivable, oversee payroll, and ensure timely preparation of tax returns and statutory filings.
	In addition, the role requires assisting in budget preparation, monitoring budget performance, and supporting audits by providing accurate documentation and explanations of financial transactions.
	The Accountant will work closely with management to provide insights on financial performance, highlight areas for cost control, and ensure transparency in all financial dealings.
	This position demands accuracy, integrity, and the ability to manage multiple accounts across different sectors, while adapting to the unique financial reporting needs of each business unit.
	The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of accounting principles, strong analytical skills, and the capacity to maintain high standards of confidentiality and professionalism.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND, HND, or Bachelor's Degree with 5-10 years of experience.


Salary
N170,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Intrested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: Nhrecruiters@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Kabsa Facility Managers Limited is a skills ecosytem hub that offers a wide range of facility management services to clients of all categories. Our services range from janitorial, corporate housekeeping, handyman, home repairs, painting, tiling, electrical repairs, property management and real estate marketing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Concierge Coordinator
Job Location:&nbsp;Asokoro, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are searching for a dedicated Concierge Coordinator to deliver exceptional guest, client, and participant experiences.
	If you excel in hospitality, have a passion for customer satisfaction, and operate smoothly in fast-paced environments, we want you on our team.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate travel arrangements, accommodation, transportation, and hospitality logistics.
	Serve as a frontline support representative during programs, events, and onsite activities.
	Provide personalized assistance to guests, ensuring comfort, timely responses, and seamless experiences.
	Maintain high service standards while juggling multiple requests and logistics.


Qualifications


	Minimum of 5 years of experience in customer service, concierge services, hospitality management, or related fields.
	Exceptionally detail-oriented, customer-focused, and service-driven.
	Excellent interpersonal and multitasking skills.
	Ability to anticipate needs and manage dynamic environments with professionalism.


Working conditions:


	We aim to have the successful candidate start immediately.





What We Offer


	Competitive Salary:N250,000 &ndash; N400,000 Monthly.
	HMO
	Pension plan.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letters to:&nbsp;ekasaarh@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.&nbsp;

Note


	Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
